intro: Azanza garckeana, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by orange-red fruits that contain sticky, milky latex. Azanza garckeana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for various ailments. Its ability to thrive in arid conditions makes it adaptable to a range of environmental conditions.
